translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders
The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules🔽The sub-chapter on sandals
1. The training rule on lying down

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sayanagatassa dhammaṁ desenti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū sayana gatassa dhammaṃ desenti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six were teaching the Teaching to people lying down. …

original: “Na sayanagatassa agilānassa dhammaṁ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: na sayana gatassa a gilānassa dhammam desessāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not teach the Teaching to anyone lying down who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”

analyzed: na sayana gatassa a gilānassa dhammaḥ desetabbo
translated: One should not teach the Teaching to anyone lying down who is not sick.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca antamaso chamāyampi nipannassa sayanagatassa agilānassa dhammaṁ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anāpatti—🔽asañcicca …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca antamaso chamāyam pi nipannassa sayana gatassa a gilānassa dhammaṃ deseti āpatti dukkaṭassa  anāpatti  a san cit ca pe
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, teaches the Teaching to someone lying down who is not sick, even if it is just on the palm of a hand, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
There is no offense if he does not intend to do it; if he is the first offender; if he is insane; if he is the first offender.
The fourth training rule is finished.
